lines.text: Amount of charge of electron and proton

secText: Charge is measured in coulombs. The unit is abbreviated with a capital C. The amount of charge is equal for an electron and a proton: about 1.60×10−19 C. If it is an electron, it is negative 1.60×10−19 C. If it is a proton, it is positive 1.60×10−19 C.

A coulomb of charge is about 6,250,000,000,000,000,000 electrons or protons.  Perhaps it is better to write it in scientific notation: a batch of 6.25×10<sup class="">18</sup> electrons or protons possesses a coulomb of charge. To give you a sense of scale, a gram of carbon contains about 5.0×10<sup class="">22</sup> atoms.
